metadata.validation: SRS-aware with placeholder blocking and deduplication

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User downloads new release through mobile app
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that a user can download a new/updated version of the software through their mobile phone.
preconditions: User is logged in to the application
A new/updated version is available
test_steps: Verify download starts and completes successfully
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: The new/updated version of the app is downloaded successfully without errors.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User attempts to download with invalid credentials
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system prevents a user from downloading a new release if they are not logged in.
preconditions: User is not logged in to the application
A new/updated version is available
test_steps: Verify 'Download Now' button does not display
Attempt to click 'Download Now' button and verify error message
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: The system displays an error message indicating that the user must be logged in to download the new version.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User downloads new release after logging in through mobile app
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system allows a user to download a new/updated version of the software after logging in.
preconditions: User is not logged in to the application
A new/updated version is available
test_steps: Verify download starts and completes successfully
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: The new/updated version of the app is downloaded successfully after logging in.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User downloads new release within time limit
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system allows a user to download a new/updated version of the software within a specified time limit.
preconditions: User is logged in to the application
A new/updated version is available
test_steps: Start timer and click 'Download Now' button
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: The new/updated version of the app is downloaded successfully within 5 minutes.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User downloads new release with secure connection
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system ensures a secure connection when downloading a new/updated version of the software.
preconditions: User is logged in to the application
A new/updated version is available
test_steps: Click 'Download Now' button and monitor network traffic
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: The download is made over a secure connection (HTTPS) to protect user data.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User downloads mobile application from Google Play Store
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that a user can successfully download the mobile application from the Google Play Store.
preconditions: Google Play Store is accessible on the device
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: The mobile application is successfully downloaded and displayed as installed in the Google Play Store.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User tries to download a non-existent app from Google Play Store
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system handles an error when a user attempts to download a non-existent application.
preconditions: Google Play Store is accessible on the device
test_steps: Verify error message displays: 'No results found'
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: An error message is displayed indicating that no results were found for the search query.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User downloads mobile application with minimum price range
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system allows a user to download the mobile application with the minimum specified price range.
preconditions: Google Play Store is accessible on the device
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: The mobile application is successfully downloaded and displayed as installed in the Google Play Store with a price range of $0.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User downloads mobile application from Google Play Store and verifies app functionality
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system allows a user to download the mobile application from the Google Play Store and that the app functions correctly.
preconditions: Google Play Store is accessible on the device
test_steps: Perform a basic action (e.g., log in, view settings)
Verify that the action is successful
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: The mobile application is successfully downloaded and displayed as installed in the Google Play Store. The app functions correctly upon opening.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User downloads mobile application from Google Play Store within 5 seconds
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system allows a user to download the mobile application from the Google Play Store within 5 seconds.
preconditions: Google Play Store is accessible on the device
test_steps: Measure time until 'Download complete' message displays
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: The mobile application is successfully downloaded and displayed as installed in the Google Play Store within 5 seconds.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User downloads mobile application from Google Play Store without authentication issues
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system allows a user to download the mobile application from the Google Play Store without any authentication issues.
preconditions: Google Play Store is accessible on the device
test_steps: Verify that no authentication prompts are required
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: The mobile application is successfully downloaded and displayed as installed in the Google Play Store without any authentication issues.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User successfully registers with valid data
phase1_test_cases.description: Test the main success scenario for user registration with real, specific data from the requirement.
preconditions: The mobile application is installed and opened
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: A confirmation message displays: 'Registration successful. Please check your email for verification.'

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User registration fails with invalid password
phase1_test_cases.description: Test error handling when a user tries to register with an invalid password.
preconditions: The mobile application is installed and opened
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: An error message displays: 'Password must be at least 8 characters long and include a mix of letters, numbers, and symbols.'

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User registration with minimum required data
phase1_test_cases.description: Test the boundary condition for user registration using only the mandatory fields.
preconditions: The mobile application is installed and opened
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: A confirmation message displays: 'Registration successful. Please check your email for verification.'

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User registration with phone number integration
phase1_test_cases.description: Test the interaction between user registration and the option to provide a regularly used phone number.
preconditions: The mobile application is installed and opened
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: A confirmation message displays: 'Registration successful. Please check your email for verification.' and the phone number is saved in user profile.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User registration performance test with large data set
phase1_test_cases.description: Test the performance of user registration when handling a large number of users simultaneously.
preconditions: The mobile application is installed and opened
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: All registrations complete within 5 minutes with no errors.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User registration security test for password encryption
phase1_test_cases.description: Test that user passwords are encrypted during the registration process.
preconditions: The mobile application is installed and opened
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: The password stored in the database is not in plain text but a hashed value.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User successfully logs in with valid credentials
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that a registered user can log in to the mobile application using correct username and password.
preconditions: User has already registered with username 'john_doe' and password 'P@ssw0rd123'
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the home screen.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Login fails with incorrect password
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system rejects login attempts with an incorrect password.
preconditions: User has already registered with username 'jane_doe' and password 'P@ssw0rd123'
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: Login fails and error message 'Invalid username or password' is displayed.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User logs in with minimum required credentials
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system allows login using only the minimum required credentials.
preconditions: User has already registered with username 'min_user' and password 'MinP@ss123'
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the home screen.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Password strength validation during registration and login
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system enforces password strength requirements during both registration and login.
preconditions: User has not yet registered
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: Registration fails and error message 'Password must be at least 8 characters long and include a number' is displayed.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User successfully retrieves password via email
phase1_test_cases.description: Test the main success scenario where a registered user can retrieve their password by email.
preconditions: User has an active account with a valid email address
test_steps: Navigate to 'Forgot Password' page at https://example.com/forgot-password
Verify 'Password Retrieval Email Sent' message displays
Check user's email inbox for password retrieval email from 'noreply@example.com'
Verify the email contains a valid password reset link
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User receives an email with a valid password reset link

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Invalid email address results in error message
phase1_test_cases.description: Test error handling when an invalid email address is entered during password retrieval.
preconditions: User has an active account with a valid email address
test_steps: Navigate to 'Forgot Password' page at https://example.com/forgot-password
Verify 'Invalid Email Address' error message displays
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: Error message indicating invalid email address is displayed

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Empty email address results in error message
phase1_test_cases.description: Test error handling when an empty email address is entered during password retrieval.
preconditions: User has an active account with a valid email address
test_steps: Navigate to 'Forgot Password' page at https://example.com/forgot-password
Verify 'Email Address is required' error message displays
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: Error message indicating email address is required is displayed

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Password retrieval feature integrates with user authentication system
phase1_test_cases.description: Test the integration between password retrieval and user authentication systems.
preconditions: User has an active account with a valid email address
test_steps: Navigate to 'Forgot Password' page at https://example.com/forgot-password
Verify user receives password retrieval email from 'noreply@example.com'
Check user's account status in the authentication system
Verify user account is not locked or disabled
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User receives a valid password reset link and their account remains active

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Password retrieval process completes within 30 seconds
phase1_test_cases.description: Test the performance of the password retrieval process to ensure it completes within a specified time limit.
preconditions: User has an active account with a valid email address
test_steps: Navigate to 'Forgot Password' page at https://example.com/forgot-password
Measure the time taken for the password retrieval process to complete
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: Password retrieval process completes within 30 seconds

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Password reset link is secure and cannot be used by unauthorized users
phase1_test_cases.description: Test the security of password reset links to ensure they are not usable by unauthorized users.
preconditions: User has an active account with a valid email address
test_steps: Navigate to 'Forgot Password' page at https://example.com/forgot-password
Verify user receives password retrieval email from 'noreply@example.com'
Check the security of the password reset link in the email
Attempt to use the password reset link on a different device or browser
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: Password reset link is secure and cannot be used by unauthorized users

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Verify interaction with filtering menu button

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User selects a restaurant pin on the map and is navigated to it using GPS after searching for restaurants

test_steps: Tap on a restaurant pin located at coordinates (40.7128, -74.0060)
Verify that the mobile phone’s GPS-navigation program opens with the destination set to the selected restaurant's address

Verify that the subsequent request returns a 200 OK status

Application is running on an iOS device with varying screen sizes
test_steps: Input different integer values for minimum (e.g., 50) and maximum price fields (e.g., 150)
Adjust the screen size to a smaller or larger resolution
Verify that the results are displayed in list view
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The application displays the search results in list view by default regardless of screen size.
phase2_test_cases.srs_section: FR12, Minimum and maximum price input

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Search with valid min and max prices, default list view
phase2_test_cases.description: Verify that the API returns results within a specified price range and displays them in list view by default.
preconditions: User is authenticated
Location-based services are enabled
test_steps: Send a GET request to /api/search with params: min_price=10, max_price=50
Verify the response status code is 200 OK
Check that the 'view' parameter in the response is set to 'list'
Count the number of results returned and verify it is between 1 and 100
Ensure each result has a price field within the range [10, 50]
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The API returns a list of results with prices between 10 and 50, displayed in list view.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Search with min equal to max price
phase2_test_cases.description: Verify that the API handles edge cases where the minimum and maximum prices are the same.
preconditions: User is authenticated
Location-based services are enabled
test_steps: Send a GET request to /api/search with params: min_price=25, max_price=25
Verify the response status code is 200 OK
Check that the 'view' parameter in the response is set to 'list'
Count the number of results returned and verify it is between 1 and 100
Ensure each result has a price field equal to 25
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The API returns a list of results with prices equal to 25, displayed in list view.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Test Minimum and Maximum Price Input with Edge Case (min = max)
phase2_test_cases.description: Verify that the application handles the edge case where the minimum price is equal to the maximum price.
preconditions: The user is logged in
The search by price page is displayed
test_steps: Navigate to the Search by Price page
Enter a specific integer value for both the minimum and maximum price fields (e.g., 50)
Verify that the results are displayed in the LIST VIEW
Check that only items within the specified price range (50 to 50) are shown
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The application displays a list view with only one item that matches the exact price of 50

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Test Data Type Constraints for Price Input (Only Integers Accepted)
phase2_test_cases.description: Verify that the application only accepts integer values for price input and rejects non-integer values.
preconditions: The user is logged in
The search by price page is displayed
test_steps: Navigate to the Search by Price page
Enter a non-integer value (e.g., 50.5) in the minimum price field
Enter a valid integer value (e.g., 100) in the maximum price field
Verify that an error message is displayed indicating invalid input
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The application displays an error message stating that only integers are accepted for price input

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Test Calculation Accuracy for Price Range
phase2_test_cases.description: Verify that the application accurately calculates and displays results within the specified price range.
preconditions: The user is logged in
The search by price page is displayed
test_steps: Navigate to the Search by Price page
Enter a minimum price of 100 and a maximum price of 200
Verify that the results are displayed in the LIST VIEW
Check that only items within the price range of 100 to 200 are shown
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The application displays a list view with items that have prices between 100 and 200, inclusive

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Network Interruption Handling during Price Search
phase2_test_cases.description: Verifies that the application handles network interruptions gracefully when performing a price search.
preconditions: User is logged in
Application is open and displaying the search page
test_steps: Set up an emulator or device with limited network connectivity
Input minimum price as 100 and maximum price as 500
Start a price search by clicking the search button
Simulate a network interruption during the search process
Observe if the application shows a network error message and allows the user to retry
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The application displays a network error message and provides an option for the user to retry the search.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: App Crash Recovery after Price Search
phase2_test_cases.description: Verifies that the application recovers from a crash during a price search and displays the results correctly.
preconditions: User is logged in
Application is open and displaying the search page
test_steps: Set up an emulator or device with limited memory to simulate a crash
Input minimum price as 100 and maximum price as 500
Start a price search by clicking the search button
Simulate a crash during the search process
Reopen the application and verify if it displays the previous search results
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The application recovers from the crash and displays the previous search results without any data loss.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Verify that users are notified of new releases and can download them through the mobile app
phase2_test_cases.description: This test validates that users receive notifications for new/updated releases and can easily download them using their mobile phone.
preconditions: User has an active account with the software
A new release is available
test_steps: Log in to the software on a mobile device
Navigate to the 'Settings' or 'Profile' section of the app
Check for any notifications related to new releases
Tap on the notification if it appears
Verify that the user is directed to a page listing available updates
Select the latest version from the list
Initiate the download process by tapping the 'Download' button
Observe the progress of the download and ensure it completes successfully
Once downloaded, verify that the new release is available in the app's main menu or through a dedicated section
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The user receives a notification about the new release, can navigate to the update page, select the latest version, initiate a successful download, and access the new release in the app after installation.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Ensure that error messages are clear when a download fails
phase2_test_cases.description: This test validates that users receive clear and understandable error messages if the download of a new release fails.
preconditions: User has an active account with the software
A new release is available
test_steps: Log in to the software on a mobile device
Navigate to the 'Settings' or 'Profile' section of the app
Check for any notifications related to new releases
Tap on the notification if it appears
Verify that the user is directed to a page listing available updates
Select the latest version from the list
Initiate the download process by tapping the 'Download' button
Simulate a download failure (e.g., by using network throttling or blocking the download URL)
Observe the error message displayed after the download attempt fails
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The user receives a clear error message indicating that the download failed, along with instructions on how to resolve the issue (e.g., checking internet connection).

test_data.expected_error_message: Download failed. Please check your internet connection and try again later.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Verify that users can navigate from the update page to the main menu after downloading a new release
phase2_test_cases.description: This test validates that users are able to easily return to the main menu of the app after successfully downloading and installing a new release.
preconditions: User has an active account with the software
A new release is available
test_steps: Log in to the software on a mobile device
Navigate to the 'Settings' or 'Profile' section of the app
Check for any notifications related to new releases
Tap on the notification if it appears
Verify that the user is directed to a page listing available updates
Select the latest version from the list
Initiate the download process by tapping the 'Download' button
Observe the progress of the download and ensure it completes successfully
Once downloaded, tap on the 'Install' or 'Open' button to install the new release
After installation, verify that the user is redirected back to the main menu of the app
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The user successfully downloads and installs the new release, and is redirected back to the main menu of the app without any errors or additional steps required.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Verify Download of New Release Notification

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Verify Download Completion Notification

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Network Interruption Handling During Download
phase2_test_cases.description: Validate that the app handles network interruptions gracefully during a release download.
preconditions: User is on a mobile device with an active internet connection
A new release is available for download
test_steps: Connect to a stable Wi-Fi network and start downloading a new release
Simulate a network interruption by turning off the Wi-Fi connection while the download is in progress
Observe if the app detects the network loss and pauses the download
Wait for 30 seconds and then reconnect to the Wi-Fi network
Verify that the app resumes downloading from where it left off
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The app should pause the download upon network interruption and resume seamlessly upon reconnection.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: GPS Signal Loss Behavior During Download
phase2_test_cases.description: Validate how the app handles GPS signal loss during a release download.
preconditions: User is on a mobile device with an active internet connection and GPS enabled
A new release is available for download
test_steps: Start downloading a new release while in an area with poor GPS signal
Simulate GPS signal loss by turning off the GPS feature of the mobile device
Observe if the app detects the GPS loss and pauses the download
Wait for 30 seconds and then turn on the GPS again
Verify that the app resumes downloading from where it left off
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The app should pause the download upon GPS signal loss and resume seamlessly upon reconnection of GPS.
